org.fosstrak.capturingapp
Class ECReportsHandler

java.lang.Object
  org.fosstrak.capturingapp.ECReportsHandler
Direct Known Subclasses:
DefaultECReportHandler
public abstract class ECReportsHandler
extends java.lang.Object

An ECReportHandler receives a ECReport and generates a EPCIS document that can be sent to an EPCIS repository. If you would like to implement your own handler, you will find some guide-lines below. In addition you can get inspiration by the default reports handler DefaultECReportHandler.

Default Execution Sequence:

If you do not override the method LinkedList<EPCISDocumentType> handle(ECReports reports), the execution sequence of the handler is as following:
  1. abstract loadRules(): load drools rules from disc.
  2. checkErrors(): checks if errors in the rule-set. If there are errors, an exception is thrown.
  3. registerKnowledgeBase(): Create a new knowledge-base kbase from the kbuilder.
  4. createSession(): Creates a drools session. By default, a StatefulKnowledgeSession is created. Notice, that all subsequent generic methods are programmed in such a way, that they can handle both StatefulKnowledgeSession and StatelessKnowledgeSession.
  5. prepareGlobalCollector(ksession): Registers a collector for the EPCIS documents. If you override the method handle make sure, to call this method before you execute the drools rules as otherwise third-party drools rules might crash.
  6. executeSession(reports):: Execute the drools rules. In StatefulKnowledgeSession the ECReports are injected via insert, in StatelessKnowledgeSession the rules are executed via execute.
  7. collectResults(): Retrieves the results from the global collector and submits them to the capture application for further delivery.

Methods to be implemented:

  • loadRules(). It is required, that this method loads the drools rules from the file-system into kbuilder.
    Example:
    kbuilder.add(
      ResourceFactory.newClassPathResource(
        changeSet,
        DefaultECReportHandler.class),
      ResourceType.CHANGE_SET);

    • Author:
    sawielan

    Method Detail

    getChangeSet

    public final java.lang.String getChangeSet()
    Returns:
    the change set that is used with this handler.

    handle

    public java.util.LinkedList<org.fosstrak.epcis.model.EPCISDocumentType> handle(org.fosstrak.ale.xsd.ale.epcglobal.ECReports reports)
                                                                        throws java.lang.RuntimeException
    this method is invoked from the capture application whenever a new ECReports is received. The resulting EPCIS document will be delivered automatically to the EPCIS repository. If you set the return value to null, then no report is generated.
    NOTICE: If you override this method, make sure that you invoke the method prepareGlobalCollector(ksession) before you invoke the rule-set.

    Parameters:
    reports - the ECReports with the EPC data.
    Returns:
    an EPCIS document when this handler consumed the report, null otherwise.
    Throws:
    java.lang.RuntimeException - when the rule(s) could not be compiled.

    executeSession

    public void executeSession(org.fosstrak.ale.xsd.ale.epcglobal.ECReports reports)
    executes the drools session. The method is aware of the two different knowledge-sessions StatelessKnowledgeSession and StatefulKnowledgeSession and invokes them respectively.

    Parameters:
    reports - the ECReports.

    createSession

    protected void createSession()
    create a new knowledge session. By default a StatefulKnowledgeSession is generated.

    registerKnowledgeBase

    protected void registerKnowledgeBase()
    register the knowledge base from the rule builder in the knowledge base.

    checkErrors

    protected void checkErrors()
                    throws java.lang.RuntimeException
    check the knowledge-builder for errors in the rules.

    Throws:
    java.lang.RuntimeException - when there are errors in the rules.

    prepareGlobalCollector

    protected void prepareGlobalCollector(java.lang.Object ksession)
    prepare a global collector where the rules can store the results to.

    Parameters:
    ksession - the session holding the collector.

    collectResults

    protected java.util.LinkedList<org.fosstrak.epcis.model.EPCISDocumentType> collectResults()
    collect the results from the rules evaluation and put them into a nice typed linked list.

    Returns:
    a linked list holding the result set.

    loadRules

    public abstract void loadRules()
    // parse and compile the rule from file
    kbuilder.add(ResourceFactory.newClassPathResource(
    "HelloWorld.drl", HelloWorld.class), ResourceType.DRL);

    dispose

    public void dispose()
    in case of a StatefullKnowledgeSession we have to call dispose at the end of execution.
